intro: Collomia tenella, commonly known as the narrowleaf phlox, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It is a member of the Polemoniaceae family and is characterized by its delicate, pink to purple flowers that bloom in late spring. The plant typically grows in dry, rocky habitats and has narrow, lance-shaped leaves. It produces small, capsule-like fruits that contain numerous seeds. Collomia tenella is often found in open areas such as meadows and gravelly slopes, where it thrives in full sun.
